page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY BURNT YATES
page.content: Clint, Burnt Yates is situated in a rural area. Burnt Yates has a very nice church that was built in 1884. It has a small school with 31 pupils. There are no shops in the village, the nearest being at Shaw Mills. There are about sixty to seventy houses many of them built during the last 20 years, and some being quite new. There is only one new house uncompleted at the present time. Many retired people live in the village, but there are some young families and generally there is a reasonably good mix of age groups. A major recreational facility is the cricket pitch organized by Burnt Yates Cricket Club which has a new clubhouse containing changing rooms and toilets. Brimham Rocks and Fountains Abbey are local points of interest. Rock climbing, walking and fishing in the River Nidd are popular.
